title: Selling Access Is a Scandal About Joe Biden, Not Hunter
summary: Politico seconds New York Post reporting on the 'big guy.'. Last year New York Post reports about Biden family enrichment schemes were dismissed by old-media firms and suppressed by new-media firms. Old or new, the press corps was generally unwilling to allow voters to see the sordid reality of a candidate who was presenting himself as superior in character to the incumbent President. Now that Mr. Biden has been in the White House for eight months, will reporters be willing to act like reporters again?

title: Elizabeth Holmes Trial: Jim Mattis Tells Jury He Came to Doubt Theranos Technology
summary: The former defense secretary said he invested $85,000 in the company and pressed the military to adopt its blood-testing devices. SAN JOSE, Calif.-Former Defense Secretary Jim Mattis testified Wednesday in the criminal trial of Theranos Inc. founder Elizabeth Holmes that he and other board members were blindsided to learn in 2015 that the company hadn't been conducting all of its blood tests using its proprietary technology.

title: Brazil's Unvaccinated President Goes Into Quarantine After Return From New York
summary: A member of Jair Bolsonaro's delegation to U.N. General Assembly tested positive for Covid-19 virus. title: The New Government Basic Income
summary: The child credit has become a new trillion-dollar entitlement for the middle class, untied to work.. The history of government entitlements is that they inevitably expand, often into something far different than how they began. There's no better example than the "child tax credit" that Democrats are now expanding into a costly guaranteed basic income for families with children. This is an enormous change in social policy and the role of government, and it's moving through Congress with no scrutiny.

title: Who Wants to Buy Hunter Biden's Art?
summary: The Congressman asking that question isn't getting a response.. title: Facebook's Chief Technology Officer to Step Down

summary: Voters face an array of possible coalitions, but very little change.. But there is no precedent for the world we're creating. The internet changes everything, as its fanboys used to say, back before the internet actually did change everything.

title: Transcript: Fed Chief Powell's Postmeeting Press Conference
summary: Resume Subscription. Additionally, he noted that while Fed officials didn't make any decisions regarding a reduction in the central bank's $120 billion a month in bond-buying stimulus, they generally view that a gradual tapering of the purchases concluding around the middle of next year would likely be appropriate if the recovery stays on track. Here is a transcript, lightly edited for clarity and length.

title: How to Score the Best Luxury Hotel Deals: 5 Expert Tips
summary: We asked industry insiders for the best advice on getting a discount at premium hotels. TWO THOUSAND DOLLARS a night for a hotel room with one king-size bed in Nantucket. More than $4,000 a night for a "Desert View Suite" in Utah. Travelers itching to get back on the road are getting an unwelcome surprise: hotel sticker shock. According to a recent survey from travel booking app Hopper, lodging prices in the U.S. are up 42% from earlier this year, and are likely to rise even more by the winter holidays. "We've seen crazy high levels at some leisure destinations," said Hopper economist Adit Damodaran. Why the spike? "Demand for hotels just skyrocketed overnight" around Memorial Day, explained Andrea Stokes, hospitality practice lead at research firm J.D. Power. Plus, many guests chose to stay stateside this year instead of going abroad. The good news: You can still ferret out bargains or wrangle a discount. We asked a few travel industry insiders for their best booking tips:

title: How Should Republicans Vote on Infrastructure?
summary: I remember another president promising 'shovel ready' projects, but what did we get for almost $1 trillion back then?. As a fellow Republican, I can sympathize with Sen. Bill Cassidy's desire to pass the infrastructure bill ("We Must Pass the Infrastructure Bill," op-ed Sept. 18). But I am disappointed that he failed to address the concerns that many of us have with it. The bill has been reported to be $1.2 trillion all summer, but the senator's article spells out only where $94.5 billion in spending will go. Can Mr. Cassidy promise Republicans that the money will be used as intended and that taxpayers will get the most bang for their buck? I remember another president promising "shovel ready" projects, but what did we get for almost one trillion dollars back then?

title: France Is America's Oldest Ally and Enemy
summary: Assistance during the Revolutionary War was as an aberration in over a century and a half of hostility.. title: Hospital Surgeons Could Use Co-Pilots' Help
summary: Aviation lives mainly in the world of physics and as such is more amenable to checklists.. Aviation lives mainly in the world of physics and as such is more amenable to checklists. Complicated systems are linear; the amount of output (say, a throttle setting) corresponds to a predictable and reproducible change (in this case, thrust from an engine).

title: Do Democrats Believe the 'Systemic Racism' Charge?
summary: Their actions in redistricting may suggest otherwise.. Jason Riley answered "yes" to his question "Is Racial Gerrymandering Going Out of Style?" It dawned on Democrats in recent years that skin color is not a top selection criterion for most voters, and Democrats have moved toward a more even distribution of black voters when given an opportunity in redistricting or court challenges of less racially diverse districts. Even as Democrats ratcheted up charges of "systemic racism," they understood that racism is less a factor in American politics than ever before.

A few families headed to the waterfront, passing underneath the archways of the Renaissance-era loggia. An old woman led her recalcitrant Maltese into the salumeria past windows displaying Italian sausage, truffles and the Balkan spicy pepper condiment known as ajvar. title: The Best House Plant Accessories-Chosen by a Pro Stylist
summary: As the weather cools and gardeners focus on interior greenery, Miami interior designer Travis London picks the standout planters, pots and watering can from four big design retailers. To prep for the occasion, we tasked Miami interior design pro Travis London with scouring the fall catalogs of a few accessible retailers for the best accessories to integrate your plant habit into your décor. title: iPad Mini Review: A Pro Tablet That Actually Fits in Your Hand
summary: The sixth iPad Mini gets the tiny tablet's first full redesign, removing the home button and headphone jack and adding a larger screen and improved cameras. My hands aren't getting any bigger, but screens certainly are. Phones are now so massive that many people use a grip to actually hold them. And, with its keyboard cover on, Apple 's largest tablet, the 12.9-inch iPad, weighs more than the MacBook Air.

title: 21 Can't-Miss Culture Moments in Movies, TV, Books, Music and Art This Fall
summary: What you need to know about the biggest movies, series, books, music and art shaping the season. The backup of pandemic-delayed movies, TV, music and books is finally starting to come unjammed. Remember those months where hardly anything new was coming out? It's the opposite now.

title: Texas Abortion Law Sending Women Out of State
summary: Louisiana, Oklahoma facilities report influx of patients from Texas looking for abortions and other services. AUSTIN, Texas-Women's health clinics in Louisiana, Oklahoma and beyond are reporting an influx of out-of-state patients from Texas looking for abortions and other services, weeks after the U.S. Supreme Court allowed Texas's restrictive abortion law to take effect.

title: Ukrainian President's Top Aide Survives Assassination Attempt
summary: Around 10 shots were fired at car carrying Serhiy Shefir, a former producer of Volodymyr Zelensky's comedy show. MOSCOW-A senior adviser to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky was the target of an assassination attempt, authorities said Wednesday, adding to a host of challenges facing the country's leader at home and abroad.

title: The Case of the Missing Mies van der Rohe
summary: After nearly 70 years, a forgotten, unbuilt design by the pioneering architect Ludwig Mies van der Rohe comes to life on Indiana University's Bloomington campus.. Rediscovering plans for a nearly unknown, never-realized Ludwig Mies van der Rohe building seems improbable. "It's like finding a Rembrandt in a desk drawer," says one of the architect's biographers, Edward Windhorst.

title: TWA Flight 800's Fragments of Grief
summary: Twenty-five years after TWA Flight 800 crashed, photographer Taryn Simon has documented the reconstructed plane as a site of grieving. When Trans World Airlines Flight 800 exploded and crashed on a summer evening in 1996 shortly after taking off from JFK airport-killing all 230 people on board-conspiracy theories abounded. Some eyewitnesses claimed to have seen a streak of light preceding the crash, prompting speculation about missiles or meteors. After four years of investigation, the National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB) concluded that explosive fuel vapors had been ignited, perhaps by an electrical failure. In July-25 years after the crash-artist Taryn Simon traveled from her home in Manhattan with a large-format camera to record a 93-foot section of the reconstructed plane, on display in a hangar in Ashburn, Virginia, before it will be destroyed, which is set to happen per the wishes of the victims' families. (The NTSB will first create a 3-D scan of each piece of debris and archive the data.) For Simon, photographing the plane is about honoring it as a site of grief. "For me it was initially thinking about memorial and remembrance and the journey from reconstruction to archive, which mimics in some ways the grieving process," says Simon, 46. "There's this kind of slow or painstaking putting together of what happened and coming to terms with it. And the assembly of all that confounds logic in the process." Simon hasn't decided whether to exhibit the images in the future. "The families' wish for the plane to be destroyed rather than turned into a public exhibition expresses a preference for one kind of loss-to lose the physical relic-over another, which is to lose a private memory to public curiosity," Simon says. "Photography can play either or both of those roles. Part of my process is not knowing how the photos I take will live in the larger world."

title: How Rick Singer's 'Side Door' Worked in College Admissions Scandal
summary: USC official testifies in withering detail about athletes' special path to entry during trial of two parents. BOSTON-College counselor William "Rick" Singer sneaked dozens of teens into what he dubbed the "side door" of top colleges using fraud and bribery to portray them as athletes. At a criminal trial this week, a University of Southern California admissions officer testified about how that door opened-and detailed the advantages that make athletics an appealing entry to college for so many U.S. families.

title: Gymnast Sunisa Lee's Plan to Compete at Auburn-and on 'Dancing With the Stars'
summary: The Olympic all-around champion-and Auburn University-are trying to pull off an unprecedented juggle of college gymnastics and cultural stardom. Sunisa Lee's plan after winning the Olympic all-around gymnastics title was to attend Auburn University, live in a college dorm, and gear up for the NCAA season.

title: Russia's New Gas Pipeline to Germany Delivers More Power to Moscow
summary: A cold winter might force European regulators to speed up the approval process for the controversial Nord Stream 2 pipeline now running between Russia and Germany. Foreign-policy hawks worried that the new Nord Stream 2 gas pipeline from Russia to Germany would increase Moscow's leverage over Europe. The first weeks after the pipeline's completion are doing little to dispel their concerns.

title: Ant to Share Consumer Credit Data With China's Government
summary: User data from lending service Huabei will be made available to the central bank's credit-reporting system. Credit data generated by Ant Group Co.'s popular consumer lending service will be fully integrated into a government credit-reporting system, a significant step in a continuing effort to bring the financial-technology giant into line with Chinese regulators' priorities.

title: Stitch Fix Relaxes Its Dress Code
summary: As Stitch Fix works to attract a wider swath of customers, it could risk losing those who valued its very specific point of view. It is a new season, so a fresh look for a retail styling company is to be expected. Whether it is an improvement for Stitch Fix might depend on whom you ask.

title: Pfizer Study of Covid-19 Vaccine in Pregnant Women Delayed by Slow Enrollment
summary: Changing guidelines, possibility of being given placebo made trial unappealing to some expectant mothers. A study led by Pfizer Inc. and BioNTech SE evaluating their Covid-19 vaccine in expectant mothers has been complicated by slow enrollment, researchers say, delaying results that could help inform physicians about how the shots affect pregnant women and their babies.

title: Netflix to Buy Roald Dahl Catalog
summary: Deal allows streaming giant to develop new content using the popular children's author's stories and characters. Netflix Inc. said it has agreed to buy the Roald Dahl Story Co., adding popular children's stories like "Charlie and the Chocolate Factory" and "Matilda" to its stable as it looks to stock up on content amid rising competition in the streaming business.

title: Invesco Teams Up in Push to Create Crypto ETFs
summary: Asset manager and Galaxy Digital aim to capitalize on investors' enthusiasm for digital assets-if and when the SEC approves the trading of such products. Invesco Ltd. , one of the biggest operators of exchange-traded funds in the U.S., is making plans to roll out a lineup of funds backed by bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies.

title: Europe's Covid-19 Vaccination Success Faces Winter Test
summary: Authorities want to increase vaccination rates to prevent the virus from overwhelming healthcare systems and shuttering economies. Europe's successful vaccination campaigns now face their toughest test: winter.

title: In Kabul, a Former American Citizen Keeps Running the City Under Taliban Watch
summary: Resume Subscription. KABUL-After attending the funeral of a fellow United Airlines pilot who was killed in the Sept. 11, 2001 attacks, Daoud Sultanzoy decided to return to his native Afghanistan and help build its post-Taliban government.

title: Fed Meeting Will Focus on Taper Timetable
summary: Officials are trying to forge consensus on how and when to reduce their asset purchases. Federal Reserve officials will look to forge agreement Wednesday over how and when to begin reducing their large-scale bond-buying efforts, which they launched early in the pandemic to stimulate the U.S. economy.

title: Ida Storm Damage Expected to Cost Insurers at Least $31 Billion
summary: Auto, home, business insurers to reflect their share of costs in third-quarter earnings. Ida is poised to join Katrina, Sandy, Harvey and Irma on the list of the top five costliest hurricanes as measured by insured losses.

title: Inside Amazon's Department Store Plans: High-Tech Dressing Rooms
summary: Company's outlets could feature QR codes, touch screens and a nontraditional shopping experience. Amazon.com Inc.'s planned department stores will aim to boost its apparel sales by offering shoppers a chance to try on clothes from its own private-label brands in technology-fueled dressing rooms, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Liz Cheney's Re-Election Bid Pits Trump Against Bush
summary: George W. Bush to hold fundraiser for Wyoming congresswoman who has sparred with Donald Trump. WASHINGTON-The race for Wyoming's single U.S. House district has pitted two of the biggest names in Republican politics against one another: both of the party's living former presidents.

title: Most of $9.2 Billion in Questionable Medicare Payments Went to 20 Insurers, Federal Investigators Say
summary: Insurers gained higher payments by recording more medical conditions for patients, using controversial methods, according to investigators. Medicare insurers drew $9.2 billion in federal payments in one year through controversial billing practices, with 20 companies benefiting disproportionately and together accounting for more than half of the total, according to federal health investigators.

title: U.S., Russian Military Officials Meet Amid Concerns About Terrorism Fight
summary: Discussions between military leaders come amid growing concerns that Afghanistan can provide a base for terrorist groups. HELSINKI-The Pentagon's top officer met with his Russian counterpart in the Finnish capital Wednesday amid American and allied efforts to find ways to fight terrorism after the departure of U.S. and allied troops from Afghanistan last month.

title: DraftKings Makes Bid for Gambling Company Entain
summary: Offer comes after MGM's effort to acquire Entain fell flat. U.S. sports-betting operator DraftKings Inc. has made a cash and stock offer for global gambling company Entain PLC in a deal valued at almost $22.4 billion.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: China's Xi Commits to Stop Building Coal Plants Abroad
summary: Beijing has been criticized by the U.S. and environmental groups over projects adding to pollution in developing countries. Chinese President Xi Jinping on Tuesday said Beijing would stop building coal-fired power plants abroad, in a public commitment to redirect the country's huge engineering industry away from adding to a source of global pollution.

title: Infrastructure Plan Faces Fresh Uncertainty as Democrats Remain Divided
summary: Progressives signal they won't back the roughly $1 trillion bipartisan bill until a separate $3.5 trillion package also advances. WASHINGTON-Persistent divisions among Democrats over the size of their climate and social-welfare plan are threatening to derail much of President Biden's agenda, as progressives signal that they could block passage of a roughly $1 trillion infrastructure package next week.

title: Debt-Limit Suspension Passes House, Faces Standoff in Senate
summary: Democrats' bill, which faces GOP opposition, would keep government funded until early December. WASHINGTON-The House passed Tuesday a measure keeping the government funded until early December and suspending its borrowing limit through 2022, but without having resolved the partisan standoff poised to derail it in the Senate.

title: Imperial Capital-Backed Eye-Care Company Weighs Sale
summary: Keplr Vision maintains a network of nearly 300 optometry practices across 35 states. Keplr Vision, a private-equity-owned business that provides operational support to optometry practices across the U.S., has been exploring options including a sale, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Rohit Chopra, Biden Pick for CFPB Head, Moves Toward Senate Confirmation
summary: Nominee faced opposition from Republicans who criticize Consumer Financial Protection Bureau for regulatory overreach. WASHINGTON-Rohit Chopra, President Biden's choice to head the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, was poised for approval by the Senate over the coming days, overcoming Republican opposition to his nomination.

title: U.S. Antitrust Suit Targets American-JetBlue Alliance
summary: The lawsuit alleges that the carriers' partnership threatens competition; the companies say they are giving consumers choices. WASHINGTON-The Justice Department on Tuesday filed an antitrust lawsuit challenging American Airlines Group Inc.'s partnership with JetBlue Airways Corp. , alleging the recently forged alliance will suppress competition and lead to higher fares.

title: Taliban Seek to Participate in U.N. Gathering in Bid to Win International Support
summary: The international body isn't expected to allow Taliban representation in the current week of high-level diplomacy. NEW YORK-The Taliban are seeking to participate in the United Nations annual gathering as part of the Afghan militant group's effort to win international recognition, after its military victory toppled Afghanistan's U.S.-backed government.
